image.altText: Xi Jinping raises his glass and proposes a toast while standing behind a lecturn in front of Chinese flags.

props.synopsis: China's government officially abolishes heavy tariffs on Australian wine, offering a potential lifeline to an industry struggling with low prices and global oversupply.

title.children: China's government officially abolishes heavy tariffs on Australian wine

image.altText: Tom Eckert smiles at camera

props.synopsis: Tess Eckert has described her husband Tom, one of three people to die in a boat tragedy off Eyre Peninsula, as "an amazing husband, father, and best friend to so many."

title.children: 'We love him endlessly': Wife pays tribute to boat tragedy victim Tom Eckert

image.altText: Cameron Brodie-Hall looks at the camera as he walks to court while holding a woman's hand.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man accused of possessing information for terrorist acts has been found not guilty by a District Court judge.

title.children: Accused Adelaide extremist found not guilty of possessing terrorist information

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Labor didn't pledge to just be better than the alternative, it vowed to set new standards. On that measure, when you consider the secrecy, the attempts to push extraordinary powers through parliament and aversion to public scrutiny, Labor is falling short.

title.children: Albanese vowed his government would be different. This week showed how far it's fallen from that promise

image.altText: craig wright

props.synopsis: Bitcoin. Ask anyone to explain it and you'll either get a blank stare or a blustery, confident answer. But one Australian man claimed to know all — until it turned out he didn't.

title.children: The Australian liar who claimed to be the creator of bitcoin

image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket looking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Mount Gambier woman Anelia Blackie has for the past three years had to make an uncomfortable five-hour car trip to Adelaide for treatment of the cancer in her spine.

title.children: Hours in the car or move house: Cancer patients in this regional town face tough choice

image.altText: Tammy Tyrrell and Jacqui Lambie

props.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Tammy Tyrrell will sit on the crossbench as an independent after announcing she is resigning from the Jacqui Lambie Network.

title.children: Tasmanian senator Tammy Tyrrell resigns from Jacqui Lambie Network

image.altText: Sign says Flinders Medical Centre

props.synopsis: The head of South Australia's health department has defended a decision to postpone elective surgeries days out from the Easter long weekend despite calls from the union to address high demand at one of the state's major hospitals two weeks ago.

title.children: SA Health denies claims it waited until the Dunstan by-election was over to pause non-urgent surgeries

image.altText: A woman on the land

props.synopsis: Scenes of violence and unrest in Alice Springs prompted the NT government to declare a two-week youth curfew in the town on Wednesday. Here's what some community members have to say about the plan.

title.children: The Alice Springs youth curfew has been called a 'circuit breaker', but some say a broader approach is needed

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs, from Anzac Hill.

props.synopsis: People under the age of 18 have been banned from the Alice Springs CBD between 6pm and 6am for the next two weeks, in a dramatic response to unrest in the town. Here's what that means.

title.children: What is a 'safe place'? Here's what we know about the Alice Springs curfew rules

image.altText: Celeste Manno.

props.synopsis: The mother of murdered woman Celeste Manno says she feels "pure disgust" that Victorian prosecutors would not go to the Court of Appeal and seek a life sentence for the man who took her daughter's life.

title.children: 'Pathetic and weak': Celeste Manno's mum hits out at prosecutors for declining to appeal killer's sentence

image.altText: Liberal candidate for Dunstan Anna Finizio.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party has conceded defeat in the South Australian seat of Dunstan, four days after voters went to the polls for a by-election triggered by the departure of former premier Steven Marshall.

title.children: SA Liberals concede defeat in Dunstan by-election, despite narrowing of vote count gap

image.altText: A woman wearing a police hat

props.synopsis: Former Channel Seven producer Steve Jackson will not take up the role of NSW Police media chief with his contract cancelled due to "ongoing media attention".

title.children: NSW Police cancels contract of new media chief two weeks after appointment

image.altText: Wildgrace 4

props.synopsis: A life coach who was linked to a high-profile controversy involving an Adelaide Crows AFL training camp has been charged with rape and indecent treatment of children.

title.children: Life coach linked to Adelaide AFL team controversy charged with rape

image.altText: A Panthers NRL player smiles as he stands with a group of his teammates after a try.

props.synopsis: Penrith Panthers got the job done without key personnel, as Sunia Turuva starred with a hat-trick in their win over the Roosters.

title.children: Terrific Turuva helps under-strength Panthers get the points over Roosters

image.altText: A Collingwood player pumps his fist in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: It's relief for Collingwood and strife for the Brisbane Lions, after the premiers repeat their grand final victory to get off the mark for 2024 at the Gabba.

title.children: Magpies off the mark against troubled Lions as Pendlebury faces scrutiny for Neale whack

image.altText: oneil patterson

props.synopsis: All major parties have referred the new laws to a Senate committee which will report back in May, with the opposition indicating it will support the legislation.

title.children: Federal opposition may support rushed immigration laws less than a day after delaying vote

image.altText: Person (Jan Cameron) walking into the Hobart Magistrates Court with a smile.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading businesswomen, Jan Cameron, will be disqualified from managing corporations for five years after being sentenced for hiding a substantial shareholding in baby formula company Bellamy's Australia.

title.children: Kathmandu founder Jan Cameron sentenced for hiding $14m shareholding in baby formula company

image.altText: A mana and woman standing together in front of greenery

props.synopsis: A four-day coronial inquiry into the deaths of four pilots near Mangalore comes to a close, after hearing victims' family members are "still trying to find the strength to continue".

title.children: Devastated families tell inquest into fatal Victorian plane crash the tragedy has 'ruined many lives'

image.altText: A woman stands near the window.

props.synopsis: Small towns across Italy are selling homes for just 1 euro to survive terminal population decline. Foreign Correspondent travelled to Sicily to see what life's really like after you buy one.

title.children: Krastina bought a 1 euro house in Sicily while on holiday. Here's how 'the dream' met reality

image.altText: Wenona School gate in 2024 with image of former AISNSW chair John Ralston inset.

props.synopsis: The chair of a prominent peak body overseeing independent schools in NSW resigns effective immediately after the ABC revealed a convicted child sex offender was on its board at the time it investigated a Cranbrook School teacher's sexually explicit emails.

title.children: Private schools peak body chair resigns after revelation child sex offender was on board at time of Cranbrook teacher investigation

image.altText: People stand under trees looking at the wreckage of a cargo ship

props.synopsis: A night shift in freezing temperatures, repairing potholes on a bridge used by tens of thousands — with two recovering, two dead and four more still missing, families wait for answers.

title.children: A simple question asked just seconds before disaster: 'Is there a crew at work on the bridge right now?'

image.altText: A white van carrying Armaguard's badge logo stationary in a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Cash transport company Armaguard has rejected a multi-million-dollar funding deal to help it avert insolvency, as supermarket giant Coles confirms its cash collection and processing services with the company have resumed.

title.children: Coles affirms it will keep taking cash as Armaguard rejects lifeline package

image.altText: Composite image of Port Hedland Councillor Adrian McRae and Russian President Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: Former Port Hedland shire president Arnold Carter says newly elected councillor Adrian McRae's fulsome endorsement of Vladimir Putin's contested election victory should bar him from council.

title.children: Call for WA councillor to resign over Russia links, Putin endorsement

image.altText: Ice on a curved globe

props.synopsis: Melting ice in Greenland and Antarctica is changing Earth's spin, which may help experts with a tricky international timekeeping dilemma, a new study suggests.

title.children: Melting ice caps are slowing Earth's spin. Here's why that's messing with time

image.altText: A dark-coloured, damaged Audi sedan in an area cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: Police are looking to speak to three people suspected to have been involved in a two-vehicle crash and a shooting that left a man wounded this afternoon. An emergency situation declared earlier has been revoked, but the investigation is ongoing.

title.children: Search for gunman after man wounded in Cairns shooting that plunged suburb into lockdown

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young man with a basketball

props.synopsis: Chudier Pal, who played college basketball in the United States, is sentenced to life in prison with a 15 year non-parole period for the murder of Stephanie Robinson in her Doubleview home.

title.children: Former US college basketballer who murdered mother of five in Perth jailed for life

image.altText: A woman holds a black dog overlooking the beach.

props.synopsis: To understand why 30-somethings feel like they're struggling financially, the ABC analysed five factors — housing, healthcare, debt, tax, and income. The data reveals this generation is caught in an economic perfect storm.

title.children: We compared the finances of 30-year-olds now, to 30-year-olds 30 years ago

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman and her adult son, who lives with intellectual disability sitting inside

props.synopsis: As legislation is introduced to parliament as part of a first step towards NDIS reform, the disability community is split about a major recommendation from a recent review of the scheme.

title.children: It might sound uncontroversial — but this NDIS reform is splitting the community

image.altText: A family poses for a photograph at a 17th birthday party. Parents have their arms around their two sons, and two grandchildren

props.synopsis: A family of seven that fled Iran 12 years ago fear they could be forced to return if the government succeeds in passing tough new deportation laws.

title.children: The Khasri family fled Iran 12 years ago. They're 'terrified' they could be forced to return under the government's new proposal

image.altText: Cameron Brodie-Hall looks at the camera as he walks to court while holding a woman's hand.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man accused of possessing information for terrorist acts has been found not guilty by a District Court judge.

title.children: Accused Adelaide extremist found not guilty of possessing terrorist information

image.altText: Two people stand in a field with large letters sitting on a hill behind them

props.synopsis: As Splendour in the Grass is cancelled and Bluesfest kicks off, experts suggest music festivals may now be the playground of older, wealthier fans.

title.children: Did tours like Taylor Swift drain music lovers' pockets, leaving nothing for Splendour?

image.altText: members of rock band blondie wearing jeans and leather jackets

props.synopsis: After media speculation about its viability, the inaugural Pandemonium Rocks festival has confirmed it will proceed on a smaller scale than first planned.

title.children: Pandemonium Festival lives up to its name, announcing massive line-up changes

image.altText: Police outside a high school

props.synopsis: A teenager who stabbed a fellow student in a premeditated attack at Carine Senior High School in Perth is sentenced to two years and seven months in juvenile detention.

title.children: Teenager jailed for stabbing fellow high school student in front of class

image.altText: A sign on a gate at the entrance of the McArthur River Mine.

props.synopsis: A toxic waste rock dump supposed to withstand harsh weather for 1,000 years, at one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has experienced erosion after record flooding, raising alarms over the infrastructure's resilience against severe weather conditions.

title.children: Traditional owners sound alarm over erosion of toxic waste rock dump at NT mine
